sections.summary: The World's Largest Currency Pair. Representing the exchange rate between the Euro and the US Dollar, it is the primary barometer for the health of the Eurozone.
sections.deep_dive: EUR/USD is the 'Anti-Dollar'. When the global economy is in a synchronized recovery, EUR/USD typically rises as capital flows out of safe-haven Dollars and into European industrial growth. In 2026, the Euro is navigating a 'Post-Energy Crisis' landscape. While the EU has diversified away from Russian gas, the structural cost of doing business in Europe remains higher than in the US. This creates a permanent headwind for the Euro. For macro traders, breaking above 1.10 signals a 'Global Risk-On' regime, while falling below Parity (1.00) indicates a systemic crisis in European banking or energy.

council_debate.macro: Driven by the 'Relative Economic Momentum' between the US and the Eurozone.
council_debate.policy: ECB vs Fed. If the ECB stays hawkish while the Fed pivots, EUR/USD rallies on the carry-trade spread.
council_debate.geopolitics: The stability of the European project. Any political fragmentation in France or Germany sends EUR/USD lower.
council_debate.technical: Parity (1.00) is the ultimate psychological and structural floor.
council_debate.tech: MiCA regulation in the EU has made the 'Digital Euro' move more volume than ever.

sections.forecast_risks: A failure of European fiscal coordination leading to a secondary 'Eurozone Sovereign Debt Crisis'.
sections.gms_conclusion: The essential hedge against US Dollar dominance.
